intro: Psychotria bhargavae, commonly known as the Bhargava psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria bhargavae is notable for its potential ethnobotanical significance, though its medicinal uses remain under study.
